intro: Nanorrhinum dibolophyllum, commonly known as the two-lobed nanorrhinum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
